meanings.definition: The minimum number of members required to be present at a meeting to make the proceedings valid.
meanings.sent1: In order to start the meeting, we need to have enough quorums present.
meanings.sent2: The quorums were met, so the meeting could officially begin.
meanings.sent3: The quorums at the meeting were so small, they could all fit in a tiny room.
meanings.sent4: The importance of quorums in a meeting is like the foundation of a building - necessary for stability.
meanings.sent5: Without the required quorums, the meeting felt incomplete and unproductive.

meanings.sent1: She was part of the exclusive quorums invited to the event.
meanings.sent2: The quorums of experts gathered to discuss the issue.
meanings.sent3: The quorums of friends always had the best movie nights.
meanings.sent4: Being in the quorums of top performers felt like being part of a winning team.
meanings.sent5: The quorums of talented artists showcased their work at the gallery.
